GameData:
- -
I'm not even paying attention to you any more. -
Most children learn that merely asking again won't get them what they want around age five. -
Even someone like you should have learned by now that you aren't getting it. -
Hello again. -
You're back. -
Oh, the hypochondriac's back. What is it this time? -
Here again? Chronic forgetfulness is one of the first signs that you're an idiot.
-
Good morning. Feeling well? -
Welcome back to Eientei! If you need anything, grab a rabbit -- they aren't doing anything important. -
You are always welcome within the walls of Eientei. -
Greetings on behalf of Princess Houraisan. -
What brings you here today? -
Hello. Are you visiting me as a leader or as a doctor? -
Sign in with the receptionist and I will be with you shortly... Oh, it's you. -
I have more important things to be doing. Make this quick. -
What is it this time? -
Oh, you came to gloat. How shocking. -
You seem determined to destroy Eientei. I bet that you think smashing a priceless sculpture with a rock makes you better than the artist who created it. -
The Princess hopes we can return to peace soon. War serves little purpose. -
The wisest course would be to end this war. I hope even you can see that. -
Isn't it time to end this destructive conflict? -
Why are you coming here? In case you have forgotten, we're at war, and that means I cannot help you out of the problems you created for yourself. -
If you're here to apologize and beg forgiveness, the answer is 'no'. -
You should make this quick. You need to go back to mismanaging your empire. -
Hello. How are your people dealing with our Research Agreement? -
I have no medicine that will stop you from telling lies! -
Hello, friend. -
{1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} is becoming... quite an issue. -
Good, I was hoping to see you. We need to coordinate our efforts against {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}. -
I hope you're ready to pull your share of the weight in fighting {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}. I can't take care of everything for you. -
Sorry, but I can't vaccinate you against the ass-kicking you are going to recieve. Nor would I want to. -
Good morning. I hope your war is going well. -
Your childish attempts to intimidate me only embarrass yourself. -
I understand why your forces would want to stay near Eientei's borders, but you must exercise better control over them. -
Here to announce that you are claiming even more land you won't use nearly as well as I could? -
While we're here, I should tell you that your aggressive campaign of expansion can only end up hurting you. Don't expand to take land you don't have the capacity to govern. -
Are you still trying to buy up all of our land? Even you should see how foolish that is. -
A bit of friendly advice: your time and resources would be better spent bolstering your infrastructure than on buying up more plots of unused land. -
Your military might is the envy of all the other Earthbound. Well done. -
You seem to be doing well, economically. I'm pleasantly surprised to be proven wrong. -
I'm only meeting with you as a courtesy. Empires as small as yours don't usually warrant my attention. -
You are barely able to defend yourself. Surprising, because savagery seems to be the one thing you primitives are good at. -
I understand that you want to lash out and destroy things you don't understand, but it's quite tiresome when you don't understand anything at all. -
What do you want? -
Make this quick. I doubt you have anything to say that interests me. -
You can apologize if you wish, but it won't make a difference. -
Wonderful. As if I didn't have enough annoyances, {1_PlayerName} brought a friend. -
Greetings. {1_PlayerName}has been talking about you. Only good things, I assure you. -
I see you've denounced {1_PlayerName}. Jealousy really is such an ugly emotion. -
If you think denouncing my foes will get you on my good side, I assure you: it will. -
I don't even know you. -
If I declared friendship with every awestruck Earthbound primitive who saw me, I wouldn't have time for anything else. -
I plan to publically condemn {1_CivName}. The Princess would prefer if you were to join us. -
{1_CivName} simply cannot be tolerated any longer. Will you aid us in wiping them off this planet? (WILL DECLARE WAR IMMEDIATELY) -
How depressingly typical of your species.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
I don't know if your failure to honor your commitments is a betrayal or simple irresponsibility, nor do I care. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Our friendship was tenuous before, but your recent actions make it clear you cannot be reasoned with. Really, it's my fault for ever thinking you could be.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
So, you stand up on the world stage to publically denounce the most intelligent person on the planet, caretaker of the Moon's technological and cultural superiority. Did you think this through? -
You think your opinion matters to me? How droll. -
Your alliance with {1_CivName} seems like a positive development for the both of you. Well done. -
You threw in your lot with {1_CivName}? I guess the rats aren't offended by each other's stink. -
Denouncing {1_CivName}? As if I needed more reason to disregard your opinion. -
At least on the matter of {1_CivName}, we can agree. -
I see you have allied with {1_CivName}. Excellent. Perhaps the two of you together might get close to contributing as much as myself. -
I am pleased to see you listened to my denunciation of {1_CivName}. -
Do you think that teaming up with {1_CivName} will let you challenge the might of the Moon? -
You're really going to cast your lot against {1_CivName}, when you know they have the backing of the Moon? Foolish.
-
Your rate of rapid expansion is quite worrisome. Not that it is a threat to me, but if you continue to expand near me I predict your empire will collapse due to overextension. -
So. Not only do you ignore my advice about the foolishness of your expansion, but you lie about it. How typical. -
It appears you cannot take a hint, but I will only warn you one more time: Stop buying plots of land near my borders, or the results will be dire. -
Your habit of purchasing plots of land near my borders is quite worrisome. Not for me, of course, but I caution you that you are accomplishing nothing but wasting your treasury. -
So. Not only do you ignore my advice about the foolishness of your expansion, but you lie about it. How typical. -
I thought I would inform you, as a courtesy, that my forces have attacked a City-State under your protection. I say this is a courtesy because the both of us know there's nothing you can do to stop me. -
It has come to my attention that Princess Kaguya has ordered an attack on one of your City-State allies. Allow me to apologize for her oversight. -
Wait a second, Pacts of Cooperation were patched out of the game! Hax! I call hax! -
Princess Kaguya believes we should seek Earthbound allies to show our peaceful nature. Of all my options, you are the least distasteful, so I officially offer you a Declaration of Friendship. -
A codified alliance would benefit the both of us; you would benefit from our superior science and culture, and we would show the other leaders we are willing to engage with them despite their inferiority. Please sign this Declaration of Friendship to make it official. -
You should be condemned for your ignorance and misdeeds. Which is exactly what I am doing. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Even the other Earthbound primitives should be warned of what a horrid savage you are. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Warmonger (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Citystates (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Taking all the land (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Wonders (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Victory Conditions (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Timeout (shouldn't appear) -
{1_PlayerName:textkey} Pact of Secrecy (shouldn't appear) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Will not cause you to declare war) -
{1_PlayerName:textkey} Pact of Secrecy end (shouldn't appear) -
{1_PlayerName:textkey} is a threat to world security, even someone like you should be able to see that. Join my war effort. -
As it falls to me again to lead this world out of ignorance, I am assembling a coalition to destroy {1_PlayerName:textkey} in order to ensure our mutual peace and prosperity. -
It's been ten turns. Just to remind you, that was when you promised you would join my war against {1_PlayerName:textkey}. -
I have given you a great deal of leeway, knowing your origins. But your actions are now unforgivable, even for the Earthbound. -
So it has come to this. You have made an enemy of me. I would say this is your last mistake, but we both know that isn't true. -
I am quite pleasantly surprised to see all that you contribute to our alliance. -
Rabbits. They're useless. I could have built an empire that spanned the globe and retaken the Moon by now, if not for the fact I have to rely on rabbits to carry out my orders. -
If I have to hear "Help me, Eirin!" from Kaguya's room one more time... You are over a thousand years old! Why haven't you learned how to do ANYTHING for yourself? -
You are a bloodthirsty savage even among bloodthirsty savages. -
I noticed you trying to eclipse my influence with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. Surely, you must agree that they benefit far more from our patronage than yours, so your efforts do nothing but harm them.
-
All you shrine maidens look alike. -
Your intelligence is dwarfed only by your beauty. You hag. -
It is inspiring to see how even a band of barbarians can come together and attempt to make a civilization. -
A complete neglect of one's military forces is probably a sign that, deep down, they know their civilization is not worth defending. -
If I were you, I would be more careful with how I dealt with the estate of Eientei in the future. Unless I enjoyed being subject to nuclear weapons. -
Bullying behavior is a clear sign of an inferior intellect. -
An inability to keep one's citizenry happy is a clear sign of failure as a leader. -
Out of the goodness of my heart, I thought I would inform you that you have to build a "settler" to create a new city. You seemed to be unaware of this. -
It's sad, isn't it, to see a leader pretending to head a great civilization, when really they have barely enough citizens for a small village? -
I appreciate your clear acknowledgment that the culture of the Moon is superior, and your admission that it would be futile to even try and create your own.
-
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} announces to the world that it is now protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. Attacking the City-State will greatly damage relations and may lead to war. -
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
-
No. -
I hadn't planned on many more settlements near you anyway, so I accept. -
I can't agree to that condition. Do you have any idea how fast rabbits reproduce? I can't agree to anything that would limit me from making more cities to put them in. -
Wonderful. This Declaration of Friendship should be quite beneficial to you. -
Pass. -
I decline. Courteously. -
This is a Pact of Secrecy line so it shouldn't appear. -
This war seems simple enough. Consider your fight joined. -
Allow me ten turns to corral enough rabbits into an army, then I can join you. -
Against my advice, Princess Kaguya has instructed me to give you what you want. -
This isn't worth fighting over. Take it. -
With an army that size, the only thing you should be demanding of anyone is pity. -
I appreciate that you asked politely, knowing you couldn't possibly take it by force. But the answer is still no. -
What could have possibly given you the idea that I would lend you any sort of charity? -
This is simply too much. Demanding more resources can't compensate for your own incompetence. -
Your avarice is quite unbecoming. -
Do you have a hearing problem? I told you the answer was no. -
Do you have a memory problem? I told you the answer was no.
-
... -
It's time to negotiate a settlement. The Princess wishes this war to end. -
Aren't you tired of fighting yet? -
It is time to show you know your place by giving tribute to your betters. -
My research needs a few more materials to go forward. -
Please, take these before Tewi finds out about them ad does something horrible with them. -
Opening your borders to Eientei can only improve the health and happiness of your citizens. -
I want to plan to make a Research Agreement later. But I don't think this text ever actually appears.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Agreeing will not form a Research Agreement yet) -
I think it would be in our best interest to embark on a Research Agreement. I'm sure your scientists will be helpful... somehow. -
Let's officially renew this deal and get on with our lives. -
The Princess will need more from you in order to renew this deal.
-
Princess Kaguya happily accepts. -
Quite generous. Thank you. -
This is better than I hoped for from you. -
Hmm. I guess I'll take it. -
The Princess accepts. -
I... suppose that is adequate. -
Of course you accept. You had no other choice. -
That's what I thought. -
With this show of contrition, I am willing to accept your apology. -
I need more than that. -
If you want to make a deal with us, you need to make a fair offer. -
No way. -
I don't know what is more insulting: the offer you just made, or the thought you could get away with it. -
I am not in the business of giving undeserved charity to savages. -
The Princess will accept the deal as it stands. -
I see no need to alter the deal any further. -
I believe this deal meets both our needs adequately. -
Here is our offer. You'll find it quite generous. -
A deal for that would be impossible. -
Nothing can make that work.
-
Now now. I know seeing someone so superior makes you angry, but violence doesn't solve anything. At least, when employed by a brute like you. -
Oh, how cute. The earthbound primitive thinks it can outwit the Moon's genius. -
I had cautioned the Princess that we must act to remove you immediately, but she pleaded for me to be merciful. And this is how you repay it? -
How disappointing. Smashing that which you don't understand won't make you any smarter, you know. -
Wonderful! I've been running low on medical cadavers. Your soldiers will do nicely. -
Once I am done with you, you're going to be so torn up even I wouldn't be able to put you back together. -
If you wanted me to assist your suicide, you need only have asked. No need to start this futile war effort just to get me to destroy you. -
Letting you live was clearly a mistake on the Princess's part, and one I will soon rectify. -
I'm going to enjoy wiping you out. -
Wonderful! Not only will I be able to send the most annoying rabbits out to war, but I'll also get to kill you! You have my gratitutde, primitive. -
At last, you have stopped all your posturing and maneuvering and shown yourself to be the savage I knew you were. I love being proven right. -
The Princess had requested that I show our wise and peaceful Lunarian nature by holding back on our military. Now that you've attacked us, I'm free to destroy you however I see fit. -
Excellent! Now I will be able to test the enhancements I've given my troops, by watching them crush your civilization to dust. -
How depressing. It seems co-existence with savages like yourself really is impossible. -
The Princess believed that if we provided an example to aspire to, we could encourage you to rise up above your savage nature. She will be crushed. -
I told the Princess this alliance wouldn't work, that betrayal was all your kind knew. She will be quite crestfallen to hear her faith in your better nature has once again been let down.
-
You are a tumor on the body of the world, one I intend to excise. -
This might sting a bit. But if I do it right, it will sting a LOT. -
This isn't going to be a war. This is euthanasia. I'm putting you out of my misery. -
How typical for your kind. In the name of the Moon, I will punish you for your betrayal. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] ...The princess demanded I say it like that. -
Our population can no longer be contained within our borders. I know you will resist, but I think you know that Eientei will make better use of your land than you will. -
Do yourself a favor and give me your cities now. The tide of Eientei's growth cannot be stopped. -
I've had enough savagery from you and your peers. Your world needs someone in charge with some actual intelligence -- someone like me. Your people will thank me for conquering them. -
I would be foolish to ignore this opportunity to remove the thorn from my side. -
If you cannot even manage to mount an army in your own defense, then clearly I am doing you a favor by conquering your lands. -
I don't like this, but I am out of options. My tactical genius should make up for my lack of forces... I hope. -
Kaguya let you live far too long. This is my last chance to undo her mistake. -
You may consider this a betrayal, but it was your own foolishness that let you think you could demand loyalty of me in the first place. -
Pretending to be friends with a savage like you was maddening. It's time to end the charade. -
Given the brutish strength of your forces, it was clear the pretending to be your ally was my only chance of destroying you. Now we will see if intelligence can overcome mindless brutality. -
It is with great regret that the Princess informs you we must now go to war. I will try and make it quick and painless. -
I truly am sorry that I have to do this. I wish there was another way. But if there was, I would have seen it. -
Well. If you will not willingly give us what we deserve, then I clearly have no choice but to take it by force.
-
What can you offer? -
Go ahead. Perhaps you will appeal to Princess Kaguya's mercy. -
Make your offer. -
Hm. Very well, I can accept. -
The Princess wishes to end this war, so we accept your offer. -
No. It was your own foolishness that started this war, and I won't let you get out of it so easily. -
No. Sooner or later you are going to have to learn that your actions have consequences. -
No. I do not forgive so quickly.
-
Excellent. -
This is good. -
Very nice. -
Thank you. -
I appreciate it. -
Thanks. -
That's a shame. -
Hm. I should have expected as much. -
I'm not mad, but I am disappointed. -
So be it. -
Very well. -
You will regret this. -
Thank you for returning those workers. I hope they will have learned their lesson and be more cautious in the future, but that's not likely. -
If you wish to start passing land back and forth with Eientei, I have to warn you that it will not end well for you. -
I doubt you have the capacity to understand the magnitude of the mistake you just made. But you will learn soon enough. -
A likely story. Know that I'm still watching you. -
I doubt you have the capacity to understand the magnitude of the mistake you just made. But you will learn soon enough. -
A likely story. Know that I'm still watching you. -
You think your words have any impact on me. How adorable. -
Exactly. -
I can't blame you. I will try and dissuade the Princess from such mistakes in the future. -
How predictable. -
It's clear I have no more need for you. -
I am glad we could clear that up. -
I am glad we could clear that up. -
I am glad we could clear that up. -
I am glad we could clear that up. -
I am glad we could clear that up. -
I would watch my words very carefully from now on, if I were you. Unless I enjoyed being struck with nuclear weapons. Maybe you are into that.
-
I am pleased to see someone else join me in following Freedom. -
Good. At least one of you has seen the wisdom of pursuing Order. -
Ah, you have come to the same conclusion I did: force is the only thing the inhabitants of this world will understand. -
I caught one of your spies trying to steal technology from us. So, not only are you ignorant, but you are also lazy. How typical. -
As much as I would love to assist your pursuit of knowledge, stealing discoveries from me only encourages your own intellectual stagnation. For your own sake, withdraw your spies. -
You have made the right decision. -
Your intellectual laziness will only hurt yourself. -
Very well. Consider the spies withdrawn. I doubt there was much more for them to learn anyway. -
You and I both know that I am going to say "As you wish, our agents will no longer conduct operations in your territory," and then keep on spying anyway. Let's not lie to ourselves. -
While we probably could have handled any {@1_CivAdjective} plan, your warning is still appreciated. -
I have it on good authority that {1_PlayerName} is plotting against you. You didn't hear it from me, though -- doctor-patient confidentiality. -
I have it on good authority that {1_PlayerName} is plotting to attack {2_CityName}. You didn't hear it from me, though -- doctor-patient confidentiality. -
I have it on good authority that {1_PlayerName} is plotting to attack you. You didn't hear it from me, though -- doctor-patient confidentiality. -
I have it on good authority that {1_PlayerName} is plotting to go attack {2_CityName} with a naval armada. You didn't hear it from me, though -- doctor-patient confidentiality. -
I have it on good authority that {1_PlayerName} is plotting to attack you with a naval armada. You didn't hear it from me, though -- doctor-patient confidentiality. -
I regret to inform you your spy has been killed. It must be terrible, knowing your foolishness caused your operative's death. -
It has come to my attention that Princess Kaguya ordered a spy into your city, who you caught and terminated. I hope you will forgive her indiscretion. -
Before you get too angry, I should notify you that the spy you killed was there on the Princess's orders, not mine. Hopefully in the future she will defer to my judgment in these matters. -
Some of my research materials are missing, and some of my lab rabbits appear to have come into a lot of money. You wouldn't know about those two being related, would you? -
Your efforts to spread your 'faith' in my lands only encourage dogmatism and magical thinking. I request you stop at once. -
I wish I could be angry at you, but I know this is completely reasonable on your part. -
The Princess will appreciate your forgiveness. -
Good. Blind faith helps no-one. -
I expected as much from an unthinking zealot. -
Very well, if your people cannot understand the truths my missionaries reveal to them, I will not trouble them further. -
No. You have no right to keep your people laboring in ignorance simply because you fear the truth. -
I am willing to accept your surrender. -
Go ahead. Let me hear you beg for mercy.
-
I'd like to see you try and stop me. -
Good. You know your place. -
I hope that in time you will forgive the Princess's indiscretion. -
The Princess appreciates that you will overlook her indiscretion. -
I'm unable to match what you offer. -
I can't give you what that's worth.
